results.title: Automation : see it now
results.creator_credit: Edward Murrow and Fred W Friendly
results.brief_description: A documentary report on the modern day industrial revolution, Automation. It traces the earlier mechanization in industry and shows the application of the newer automation in present-day industry. Between the extremes of considering automation a menace to our way of life, or as the solution of every problem, the film presents viewpoints on the subjects ranging from a working man to the head of I.B.M. All state it is inevitable. Automation is shown in such industries as the automotive, aviation, baking, electronics, manufacturing industries and many others.

results.title: Automania 2000
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated satire on problems of automotive design and lack of proper roads and parking facilities. Shows what could happen in the year 2000 when people are forced to live in their cars and the car finally becomes able to reproduce itself. Animator: Harold Whitaker; Writer: Joy Batchelor.

results.title: Autobahn
results.brief_description: An animated film by John Halas which attempts to convey the experience of a car journey in the form of abstract imagery. Animation, movement, colour and sound are combined to emphasise Kraftwerk’s famous musical composition. Intended audience: secondary school through adult.

results.title: Autistic Syndrome 1
results.creator_credit: Stichting Film and Wetenschap Universitaire Film
results.brief_description: Presents some aspects of psychotherapy in a three year old autistic girl during her first year of residential treatment. We see her with her twin sister and with her therapist. A year later the twin sisters are observed with interest focused on changes in behaviour. No other credits available.

results.title: Child psychiatry: autism's lonely children
results.creator_credit: Jack Willis, Philip Burton, David Prowitt and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Explains the work of Dr. Frank Hewett in teaching autistic children to talk and identify objects. Shows work with a child and Dr. Hewett attempting to transfer to the child’s parents techniques used successfully to evoke responses. Discusses the possible effectiveness of the approach on other autistic children.

results.title: Autism without tears
results.creator_credit: Joan M. Curtis and Mansfield Playschool
results.brief_description: Produced to help people understand the autistic child. The Mansfield Playschool is conducted during the Christmas period as a holiday and instructional camp for autistic children and their families. Simple demonstrations of work being done and the reason for the use of special techniques are included. Narrated by Dr Joan M. Curtis.

results.title: Australia's wheat
results.creator_credit: Heinz Fenke, John Gray, Kit Guyatt, Lilias Fraser, Stephen Carthew, AWB Limited and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Provides an outline of the Australian wheat industry, a brief history and general view of growing, harvesting, bulk handling and processing, research and marketing. Shows the industry from the historical beginnings at Experiment Farm and the growing colony of New South Wales, to mechanical innovation, nationwide research and modern transport and handling. Explains the farmer’s work through each season and traces the marketing of the grain from the country silo to the consumers overseas.

results.title: Australia's greatest river
results.brief_description: A study of the Murray River and the countryside and towns along its banks. Emphasizes the danger of over stocking, over cropping, and forest fires, and shows how steps are being taken to overcome these.
